name: infernally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
old-fashioned in a very bad or unpleasant way: Some of these games can be infernally addictive. Life can get infernally difficult for people on low incomes.
in a way that has the qualities of hell (= the place where some people believe bad people go after death): It can get infernally hot here in the summer months.
More examplesFewer examplesShe spoke so quickly that it was infernally hard to follow what she was saying.I find most political memoirs are infernally dull to read.Why do you always take such an infernally long time to get ready?The queen laughed infernally as the prisoners were led away.
